You will recall that Mr. Graydon Ausmus received a letter
*1* dated March 26, 195^ from The Fund for Adult Education,
announcing the approval of a grant of $7>000 for one year
beginning April 1, 195^, to the National Association of
Educational Broadcasters to make possible the establishment
of a regular, comprehensive personnel service aimed at
serving the needs of the entire field of educational tele¬
vision and radio.
You will recall also that a letter dated April 23, 195^ to
Mr. Ausmus announced another grant of $7,000 to the
National Association of Educational Broadcasters for the
purpose of continuing the personnel placement service for
a second year beginning April 1, 1955•
In discussions you have had with Mr. G. H. Griffiths of our
staff and from Dr. Harry J. Skomia's letter dated December 13,
195I4. to Mr. Griffiths, it appears that it would be desirable
to bring the time period covered by these grants into line
with your regular fiscal year ending June 30 and that in order
to maintain continuity in the personnel placement services to
June 30, 1956 an additional amount of $1,500 is required. It
is my pleasure to inform you therefore that the Fund has ap¬
proved a grant of $1,500 to provide for the continuation of
the personnel placement service to June 30, 1956. The
provisions and terms of this grant will be the same as those
set forth in my letters of March 26, 195^ and April 23, 195^
to Mr. Ausmus with respect to the earlier grants.
Mr. Griffiths will continue to be in close touch with you.
Our Board would like to receive a progress report on this
grant by May 1, 1955 io time for its meeting later that
month. An audited financial statement at the end of your
fiscal year would also be appreciated.
